The item is not added to the health record until the
method is called.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified date and time.

The type of the medical encounter.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

member.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for the item type.

member.summary: Populates this medical encounter instance from the data in the XML.

member.summary: Writes the medical encounter data to the specified XmlWriter.

member.exception: The property has not been set.

member.summary: Gets a string representation of the encounter item.
member.returns: A string representation of the encounter item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.EncounterV1.When
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time when the medical encounter occurred.
member.value: A instance representing the date. The default value is the current year, month, and day.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.EncounterV1.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of medical encounter.
member.value: A string representing the encounter type.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the type should not be stored.
member.exception: If is null, empty, or contains only whitespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.EncounterV1.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for the medical encounter.
member.value: A string representing the encounter identifier.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the identifier should not be stored.

member.summary: Gets or sets the encounter duration.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the duration should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.EncounterV1.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the encounter location.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the location should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.EncounterV1.ConsentGranted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether consent has been granted.
member.value: trueif consent has been granted for this medical encounter; otherwise, false. If null, it is unknown whether consent has been granted.

member.summary: Gets a string representation of the lab test result type item.

member.summary: Gets or sets date and the time of the laboratory test.
member.remarks: They should be set to null if they are unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the laboratory test.
member.remarks: It should be set to null or empty if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.Substance
member.summary: Gets or sets substance that is tested.
member.remarks: It should be set to null if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.CollectionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection method for the laboratory test.
member.remarks: It should be set to null if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.ClinicalCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the clinical code for the lab tests.
member.remarks: It should be set to null if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the clinical value within a laboratory result.
member.remarks: The type of value is defined within a laboratory result, which includes value, unit, reference and toxic range. It should be set to null if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the laboratory results.
member.remarks: Examples of status include complete and pending. It should be set to null if it is unknown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultDetailsV1.Note
member.summary: Gets or sets a note that augments the laboratory result.
member.remarks: There are two scenarios in which a note is typically added: A note may provide additional information about interpreting the result beyond what is stored in the ranges associated with the value. Or, a note may be use to provide the textual result of a lab test that does not have a measured value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.LabTestResultValueV1
member.summary: A clinical value within a laboratory result.
member.remarks: This type defines a clinical value within a laboratory result, including value, unit, reference, and toxic ranges.

member.summary: Gets whether medication is prescribed.
member.returns: true if medication has been prescribed, false if medication has not been prescribed, or null if t is unknown whether medication is prescribed.

member.remarks: Set the value to null if the indication should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.MedicationV1.DoseUnit

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of total refills for the medication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1
member.summary: Represents a health record item type that encapsulates a medical procedure.
member.remarks: Note: Please use the new version of this data type instead of this version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with default values.
member.remarks: The item is not added to the health record until the method is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.#ctor(Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.HealthServiceDateTime)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified date and time.
member.param: The date/time for the procedure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.TypeId
member.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for the item type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.ParseXml(System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable)
member.summary: Populates this procedure instance from the data in the XML.
member.param: The XML to get the procedure data from.
member.exception: The first node in is not a procedure node.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the procedure data to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The XmlWriter to write the procedure data to.
member.exception: The property has not been set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the procedure.
member.returns: A string representing the procedure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.When
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time when the procedure occurred.
member.value: A instance representing the date. The default value is the current year, month, and day.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title for the procedure.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the title should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.PrimaryProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the primary provider contact information.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the primary provider contact information should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.AnatomicLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the anatomic location for the procedure.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the location should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.ProcedureV1.SecondaryProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the secondary provider contact information.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the secondary provider contact information should not be stored.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample
member.summary: Represents a single sample of a measurement or data point.
member.remarks: A sample is a single measurement within a larger activity. For instance, the a single heart rate reading during an aerobic activity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with no value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified time offset.
member.param: The time offset in seconds from the start of the sample set.
member.exception: The parameter is less than zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.#ctor(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified time offset and value.
member.param: The time offset in seconds from the start of the sample set.
The value.
member.exception: The parameter is less than zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.ParseXml(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Populates the data for the measurement from the XML.
member.param: The XML node representing the measurement.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.WriteXml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the sample to the specified XML writer.
member.param: The name of the outer element for the sample.
The XmlWriter to write the sample to.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.TimeOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the time offset in seconds from the start of the sample set.
member.value: A number representing the time offset, in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.Note
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the sample.
member.remarks: If the value is null, the note will not be saved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Sample.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the sample.
member.value: A string representing the value of the sample.
member.remarks: A sample value can consist of a single integer or a double, as for a heart rate sample or speed sample. It can also be a more complex value such as longitude and latitude for position. The format of the value depends on the sample type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet
member.summary: Represents a set of samples within a larger activity or reading.
member.remarks: An example of a sample set is a set of heart rate readings during an aerobic activity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with no value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.#ctor(Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.HealthServiceDateTime)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified start time for the set.
member.param: The time when the samples in the set started.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.#ctor(Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.HealthServiceDateTime,System.String,Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.CodableValue)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified start time for the set.
member.param: The time when the samples in the set started.
Text description of the unit of measure for the sample values in this set.
Vocabulary code for the unit of measure for the sample values in this set.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.ParseXml(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Populates the data for the sample set from the XML.
member.param: The XML node representing the sample set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.WriteXml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the sample set to the specified XML writer.
member.param: The name of the outer element for the sample set.
The XmlWriter to write the sample set to.
member.exception: The parameter is null or empty.
The , , or property has not been set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.BaseTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time when the sample set started recording samples.
member.value: A representing the starting time for sample recording.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.SampleUnit
member.summary: Gets a text description of the unit of measure for the sample values in this set.
member.exception: The parameter is null, empty, or contains only whitespace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.SampleUnitCode
member.summary: Gets the vocabulary code for the unit of measure for the sample values in this set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.SampleSet.Samples
member.summary: Gets a collection containing the samples in the set.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer
member.summary: Represents a health record item that encapsulates a single reading from a spirometer.
member.remarks: Note: Please use the peak flow type instead of this type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with default values.
member.remarks: The item is not added to the health record until the method is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.#ctor(Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.HealthServiceDateTime)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class specifying the mandatory values.
member.param: The date and time when the spirometer reading occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.TypeId
member.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier for the item type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.ParseXml(System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable)
member.summary: Populates this instance from the data in the XML.
member.param: The XML to get the spirometer data from.
member.exception: The first node in the parameter is not a spirometer node.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the spirometer data to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The XmlWriter to write the spirometer use data to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the spirometer reading.
member.returns: A string representing the vault of the spirometer reading.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.When
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the spirometer reading occurred.
member.returns: A instance representing the date and time.
member.remarks: The value defaults to the current year, month, and day.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.ForcedExpiratoryVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the forced expiratory volume measured in liters per second (L/s).
member.returns: A number representing the volume.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the forced expiratory volume should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.PeakExpiratoryFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets the peak expiratory flow measured in liters per second (L/s).
member.returns: A number representing the peak flow.
member.remarks: Set the value to null if the peak expiratory flow should not be stored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Warnings
member.summary: Gets a collection of the warnings that occurred during the reading.
member.returns: A collection of strings representing the warnings.
member.remarks:
To add a warning, pass a string containing the warning message to the Add method of a returned collection.
Warnings indicate the reading was not normal. The text of the warning tells what is of concern.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Problems
member.summary: Gets a collection of the problems that occurred during the reading.
member.returns: A collection of strings representing the problems.
member.remarks:
To add a problem, pass a string containing the problem message to the Add method of a returned collection.
Problems indicate the reading was not normal and indicates an action should be taken. The text of the problem tells what is of concern.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.FevOverFvc
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the Forced Expiratory Volume (FEV) over Forced Vital Capacity (FVC).
member.returns: A collection of strings representing the ratio.
member.remarks: In healthy adults, this value should be approximately 75-80%.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Fef25to75
member.summary: Gets or sets the average flow of air coming out of the lungs during the middle (25-75%) portion of the expiration.
member.returns: A number representing the flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Fef25to50
member.summary: Gets or sets the average flow of air coming out of the lungs during the middle (25-50%) portion of the expiration.
member.returns: A number representing the flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Fif25to75
member.summary: Gets or sets the average inspiratory flow during the middle (25-75%) portion of inspiration.
member.returns: A number representing the flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.Fif25to50
member.summary: Gets or sets the average inspiratory flow during the middle (25-50%) portion of inspiration.
member.returns: A number representing the flow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.ForcedExpiratoryTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of expiration in seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.SlowVitalCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the capacity of the lungs during expiration or inspiration, measured in liters (L).
member.returns: A number representing the capacity in liters (L).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.TidalVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the tidal volume, measured in liters (L).
member.returns: A number representing the volume measured in liters (L).
member.remarks: This is the specific volume of air that is drawn into and then expired out of the lungs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.Spirometer.MaxVoluntaryVentilation
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum voluntary ventilation (MVV) measured in liters per second (L/s).
member.returns: A number representing the ventilation measured in liters per second (L/s).
member.remarks: For this test, patients inspire and expire into the spirometer over and over again as fast as they can, for at least 12 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1
member.summary: A test result range defines the minimum and the maximum of a specific test result value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class with default values.
member.remarks: Each test result can contain multiple ranges that are useful to interpret the result value. Examples include reference range and therapeutic range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.#ctor(Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.CodableValue,Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.DoubleRange)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the class with mandatory parameters.
member.param: Type is the type of a test result.
Range is values of minimum and maximum of a test result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.ParseXml(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Populates this instance from the data in the XML.
member.param: The XML to get the test result range data from.
member.exception: The first node in is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.WriteXml(System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes the test result range data to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The name of the node to write XML.
The XmlWriter to write the test result range data to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the test result range item.
member.returns: A string representation of the test result range item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.Range
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of the test result.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Health.ItemTypes.Old.TestResultRangeV1.RangeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the range.
